content: I made a dragon but it's dead
alright nerds this program will be snake shaped so let's start by cutting a long
rounded piece of foam you get it round enough by cutting away the edges of this
piece I tried to bend it into shape that didn't work well instead I cut small
segments that fit together to create the curved shape for the body of the Dragon
yeah that looks about right cocktail sticks I will use these sticks together
with glue to attach the pieces I put some glue on the stick poked it in added
more glue and there we go I repeated the process for each piece and here I had to
make some adjustments so I cut away a bit of this piece okay nice hey let's
make one more piece before I show you how to make the dragon's head
this will be the tails I guess like up this curved shape Bend it a bit and then
rounded the corners let's check the fit okay just one more cut here and I'll
glue them together yes pretty nice now we'll use cardstock to make the head
just as I did with this blue dragon I'll assemble the head from cardstock cutouts
this is what I came up with a skull piece and the jaw I'll just cut them out
with a sharp blade
all right there we go this looks decent I'll quickly make some adjustments here
and here looks nice but let's get rid of this okay I'm happy with this and of
course we need two of each piece by the way you can find the cutout templates in
the description below but you can use them if you don't subscribe let's move
along the pieces should be in this position I have this foam piece for the
neck I'll just make some cuts in an angle add some glue and now I can attach
the skull pieces ah a bit of excess foam let's get rid of it and now the jaws I
bent the pieces like this and then glued them on I have to say this is one of our
best dragon head so far next something for the top of the head that's almost
fits I'll just make some adjustments then I bent it in the perfect shape
and glued it on it fits that's so satisfying the head is almost done I
made this piece that I could under the head as you can see it doesn't fit that
well and I used a lot of glue to fix that now I also added glue here
congratulations the head is done we did it now let's
attach the head I'll add one more foam piece between the head and the body now
all the pieces fit together so I'll just attach everything like before glue and
cocktail sticks before the glue dried I also adjusted the tilt of the head now
we can start with the interesting parts when cutting out the bones or ribs from
card stock I made many of these crescent-shaped pieces and in different
sizes of course the bones will get smaller when we move down the length of
the body the bones need to be curved so I bent them with the help of a pencil
like this when I was done with this I started gluing them on this is not
precision work I just eyeballed the spacing and angle between the curved
bones as I moved further down the body of the creature
I glued on smaller and smaller bones once in a while
I knocked some pieces out of position but overall this part of the build was
an easy and satisfying task and finally here is the last piece looks pretty cool
once tried I bent some of the bones so they look better yes barbecue sticks
you probably know what this will be I cut the ends of the sticks this will be
used as spikes along the spine according to my calculations I need a total of 35
spikes or even more okay I got the spikes now let's glue them all
this is fun looks good so far the glue works better of this camera angle I made
sure the spikes weren't pointing at each other since this is an undead creature
they can point in any direction I want just the tail left or can you even call
this a tail this is basically a head attached to a tail let's keep adding
pointy objects this time cocktail sticks I tried to cut all the sticks at the
same time because that's fun I glued the sticks in the spaces between the ribs
should look something like this and
there we have the last spike I lied more spikes I added more of the bpq
spikes behind the head and on the head and some more cocktail sticks there we
go this will look scary or something a few spike here as well
awesome we could call it a day and keep this as a bone Naga but we won't because
Dragons let's add wings I took some barbecue sticks and bent
them by gently breaking them like this I made four pairs of these arms that will
hold the wings as you can see they are of varying size large to small I glued
them into the foam a later char from the sticks so it's easier to poke them into
the fold okay cool this already looks creepy just
wait until we make the dead raggedy wings after gluing them on I adjusted
the position of the sticks a bit for the next step go to your toilet find some
water and add glue I cut rough pieces from the toilet paper and soaked them
into the glue water mixture I attach the paper and started shaping it the regular
look of the wings is created by ripping and cutting and fiddling around with a
stick I just kept adding more glue so paper
pieces and then created holes and tears
once in a while I also added more glue stop something is
missing here yeah I added this small stick here and also these now the wings
look mightier and of course I also added paper on these new sticks there now the
glue has dried of course I will add more glue this will make the wings more
durable than you would expect the wings are actually quite durable already this
is the last time this creature will see sunlight the glue dried very fast and I
also added diluted glue over the entire miniature to make it stronger
I took some cardstock and cut out eyes the Evo kind of course then I made
something sharp this will become a tooth I cut off the pointy bit and then glued
it behind the cardstock of the mouth I just tuck it into the foam and I only
added a few teeth on the lower jaw for this head we will need more textures i
coated the head with PVA glue the same we have been using for this entire build
then I made wavy textures with the help of a stick the textures will be less
visible once the glue has dried but now it looks like this we have come far in
this journey but it's not over yet let's paint first I base paint at the entire
miniature with black as you can see the wings are strong enough you can mess
around with the paintbrush without causing any harm painting between the
spikes was a bit tricky but we did it here it is all in black ready for
painting with white okay here I'm using a paint called Drake tooth it's almost
white I did what I call a sloppy dry brushing now you can start to see the
textures we made with the glue
then I painted the crescent-shaped bones with the same veins also don't forget to
paint the bones that are visible to the damage at wheels then I took some green
plain and colored the spikes I didn't fully cover them with this pen I left
most of the spikes base as black let's also color the spikes coming out
of the wings and any areas on the limbs that are not covered with paper are you
still following it's time to drivers the spikes with the Drake to it white as you
can see I applied most of the paint on top of the spikes okay it should look
something like this nice now let's also dry brush the wings
with the same page oh this is starting to look like something let's have some
strange glow to the holes of the wings first I added green around the edges of
holes and tears of the wing there I'm done with that I also did the other side
before changing to yellow this color is called demonic yellow I painted the
edges of holes and tears again but made sure to not cover all of the green paint
in order to get a glowy looking transition
let's also paint some of the outer edges with the yellow I quickly painted these
spikes with green then added some yellow and tried to make a smooth transition
now let's finish the head i dry brushed with the green first focusing on the
front and the protruding features of the head and let's not forget the top ok now
comes the yellow dry brushing this might look too colorful and bright that's why
I added black wash this wash brings out even more textures and darkens the head
a bit and why not use the wash on the boat yeah that looks better don't you
think let's take some black paint and color
the eyes first and also of the teeth back to the eyes I carefully painted
with green and then added yellow to make the eyes stand out I drivers the
surrounding area with black this is the first time I have applied makeup to an
undead dragon but hey it looks better now ok let's add some yellow on the
spikes I just drive rust on some yellow in the middle of the spike that's nice I
think we are done with the painting wow this has to be one of my best crafts so
far and hey do you have any cool ideas for stats and abilities for this
dracolich if you have something good I'll put it in the stack block of this
monster so here we have some nice images did you like this episode yes click like
and if you made it all the way here to describe while you're at it so write
your ideas in the comments straighten your back and watch some of my other
tutorials and also you can support my art on patreon all these sticks and
earthlike packages are really expensive I promise
